page.title: 14WHITE LODGE STUD FARM VISIT
page.content: We visited Mr Kinsey the stud groom of White Lodge Stud Farm, and he showed us round. The stud farm is 73 acres and has 7 fields and about 60 horses. The stud breeds horses for racing. They only breed thoroughbred horses because they are strong and they can win races. Around the fields there are fences and there are hedges and trees. They are not there for eating, but for wind shelters. There is a field on the stud near the main house where people can look over from their garden to the field without a fence in the way. The horses cannot escape because there is a dip in the field. There is a big vegetable garden and greenhouses on the stud. They grow the food for the stud owners who live in London, and if they have too much food they give it to charity.
